description: Send Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) messages

aws_secret_key.description: AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

aws_access_key.description: AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

http.description: Message to send to HTTP-only subscription

sqs.description: Message to send to SQS-only subscription

region.description: The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.

sms.description: Message to send to SMS-only subscription

topic.description: The topic you want to publish to.

https.description: Message to send to HTTPS-only subscription

message_attributes.description: Dictionary of message attributes. These are optional structured data entries to be sent along to the endpoint. This is in AWS's distinct Name/Type/Value format; see example below.

email.description: Message to send to email-only subscription

message_structure.description: The payload format to use for the message. This must be 'json' to support non-default messages (`http`, `https`, `email`, `sms`, `sqs`). It must be 'string' to support message_attributes.
